page.title: 06THE BARBROOK RESERVOIR
page.content:
We wrote to the Severn Trent water authority and this is the information they gave us. The reservoir and treatment works at Barbrook were built in 1908. The reservoir's top water level is 326.7 metres above sea level, and it holds 68.5 million gallons (309.1 X 103 m3). Top water level area is 32 acres (12.9 hectares) and when full its maximum depth is 7.7 meters. Water from the reservoir is treated in the building at the reservoir and then is distributed to parts of Homesford and Dronfield. Average daily output is 500,000.
BY SIMON VAUGHAN AND PAUL SHARROCK
